#Text=Get Free Books
#Text=Voracious reader on a budget have many ways to satisfy their desire for books .
#Text=Hundreds of online book communities trade and giveaway books , release them " into the wild , " or organize local meetups .
#Text=Learn about all these options , plus a few ways to find books through face-to-face interaction .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Getting Free Paper Books
#Text=Trade books online .
#Text=There are several well-known sites dedicated to trading books .
#Text=Here are a few options :
#Text=Join a books-by-mail site such as BookMooch , WhatsOnMyBookshelf , or PaperBackSwap .
#Text=You mail out books to other users , earning points to request books for yourself .
#Text=Sign up for BookCrossing to join a worldwide community of readers passing on books from hand to hand .
#Text=To avoid long-distance postage , search online for country-specific sites , such as BookSwapAustralia or the UK 's Read It Swap It .
#Text=Join general giveaway websites .
#Text=These are n't limited to books , but that does n't mean you ca n't find readable treasures .
#Text=A few options include :
#Text=Joining a local Freecycle to find free things in your neighborhood .
#Text=TitleTrader for books , films , and music .
#Text=The free section of sites such as craiglist , Yerdle , or freelywheely .
#Text=Be cautious and meet strangers in public during the day .
#Text=Organize your own book swap .
#Text=If you have extra books , invite friends and family over to trade for them .
#Text=It 's best to trade all books one-for-one , regardless of value .
#Text=This keeps things friendly and focused on good books , not good deals .
#Text=Dumpster dive at charity shops .
#Text=Charity shops and thrift shops often have giveaway bins of stuff they ca n't sell .
#Text=If you 're lucky , you might live near a " shop " that gives books away , such as Book-Cycle in the UK .
#Text=Find public bookcases .
#Text=The Little Free Library project has been spreading miniature book-filled houses across many lawns and sidewalks .
#Text=Many of these are registered on the project 's online map .
#Text=Cafés , libraries , and college campus buildings have been using this " public bookcase " idea for much longer , but most of these can only be discovered by word of mouth .
#Text=If none of your bookworm friends have discovered these , try finding an online forum for your neighborhood and asking about them there .
#Text=Starting your own is a great way to collect books and meet other readers in your area .
#Text=If you live in an apartment building , ask your landlord if you can put a bookcase in the lobby .
#Text=Keep an eye out for book giveaways .
#Text=Authors sometimes give away their books as a promotion , or in trade for a public review .
#Text=You can find these most easily on large book community sites such as Library Thing and Young Adult and Kids Books Central .
#Text=The #amazongiveaway Twitter hashtag usually has several book or ebook giveaways going on .
#Text=View it " Live " instead of " Top " to see all recent results .
#Text=Small blogs host these contests as well , but it 's not worth tracking them down unless you follow the blog already .
#Text=Look through book blogger directories online if you 're interested in hearing from authors , reviewers , and other people in the book world .
#Text=Get the most out of your library .
#Text=If you think you 've exhausted your local library 's supply , talk to a librarian .
#Text=Most libraries let you order books from other branches , or borrow online content using your library card .
#Text=You can request a specific book from the head librarian or a Friend of the Library organization .
#Text=Depending on budget , the staff may be willing to purchase that book for the collection , and let you know when it arrives .
#Text=Volunteer in exchange for books .
#Text=If you know someone with a full attic or garage , offer to organize it in exchange for books you find in the process .
#Text=Bookstores and libraries may also be willing to give you overstock for a few hours of shelving .
#Text=Finding Free Ebooks
#Text=Find a free ereader for the computer .
#Text=Many ebook sites offer computer-friendly file formats , but reading pdfs or text files can be a pain .
#Text=If you do n't have an ereader device but do have a computer , try these free options :
#Text=Download FBReader to read all common ebook formats , including epub and MOBI .
#Text=The Mac version is incomplete as of February 2016 .
#Text=Download Adobe Digital Editions to read the epub format .
#Text=Read Kindle ( MOBI format ) ebooks using Kindle Cloud Reader , Kindle for PC , or Kindle for Mac .
#Text=Browse free ebook collections .
#Text=There are dozens of online databases dedicated to free ebooks .
#Text=These often focus on new , unknown authors , but there are exceptions .
#Text=ManyBooks.net , GetFreeBooks , and Free-Ebooks.net are just a few places to start .
#Text=Search in copyright-free collections .
#Text=The most famous of these is Project Gutenberg , with its massive collection of public works .
#Text=The Internet Archive , ReadPrint.com , Europeana , and Digital Public Library of America are similar projects .
#Text=If your country has strict copyright laws , it is possible that a work may still be illegal to download in your country .
#Text=For example , Project Gutenberg Australia includes some works which are still copyrighted in the U.S.
#Text=Check the free sections of ebook stores .
#Text=Almost all ebook stores have a free section , including the Amazon Kindle Store , Kobo , Nook Books , and Google Play Books .
#Text=Less well-known options include Smashwords , a popular indie publishing site , and Feedbooks , an ebook store aimed at mobile devices .
#Text=Borrow ebooks from your library .
#Text=More and more libraries are providing free , temporary ebook downloads , straight onto a personal device .
#Text=Check with your library to find out if it uses the Overdrive app or another system .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you do n't mind paying US $ 2 or less for a book , you can find cheap deals at library book sales and warehouse clearance sales .
#Text=Quick Summary
